PARAGRAPH.STRING: (the "king of the Valais") is one of the highest mountains in the Bernese Alps. The northeast and southern slopes of
are part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site that also includes the Jungfrau and the Aletsch Glacier.
is located south of the Lötschental valley and at the north end of the Bietschtal valley and Baltschiedertal valley.
is 3938 meters high. Most climbers approach
from either the Bietschhornhütte or the Baltscheiderklause.
is regarded a fairly difficult mountain to climb.

was first climbed on 13 August 1859 by Leslie Stephen, with guides Anton Siegen, Johann Siegen and Joseph Ebener. An account of this first ascent was published by Leslie Stephen in his book 'The playground of Europe' (1871).
